page.title: 06FARMING 2
page.content: He has l4 acres of sprouts, 11 acres of spring wheat, ll acres of potatoes, 40 acres of winter barley, 45 acres of spring barley, 8 acres of savoy cabbages, 3 acres of white cabbage. 96 acres of the land is grass and 36 acres, vegetables. 60% of all crops in our area is grass and grain and 40% is vegetables. You can only put l crop ina field for two years because otherwise you might get a disease of whichever crop you plant. There is usually a 5 year rotation for each separate field such as cabbages, wheat, rye, cauliflowers and sprouts. Mr. Morrey does not have any animals apart from some chickens and ducks because the land around his area is better for growing crops and he would make a better profit if he grew crops on his land.
